meanings.definition: A picture, description, or imitation of a person or thing in which certain striking characteristics are exaggerated in order to create a comic or grotesque effect.
meanings.sent1: The caricature of the president made his nose look huge.
meanings.sent2: She drew a funny caricature of her teacher on the chalkboard.
meanings.sent3: The caricature of the cat with a giant tail made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His exaggerated caricature of a superhero was both hilarious and memorable.
meanings.sent5: The artist's caricature of the famous actor was so exaggerated that it became a talking point.

meanings.definition: To make or give a caricature of; represent in caricature.
meanings.sent1: He decided to caricature his boss by drawing a cartoon version of him.
meanings.sent2: The comedian loved to caricature famous politicians in his sketches.
meanings.sent3: She caricatured her friend's dance moves in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The artist's ability to caricature expressions was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: Caricaturing the city skyline, he added exaggerated buildings that stood out.
